body.p: Match the types of pressure involved in net filtration pressure (NFP) with their descriptions.

response.feedback: Correct. Colloid osmotic pressure is the pressure created by dissolved proteins separated by a semipermeable membrane.
Incorrect. Colloid osmotic pressures are not the same as blood pressure.
Incorrect. You chose the correct category of pressures, but from the wrong compartment.
Incorrect. Colloid osmotic pressure is not the same as the pressure exerted on the wall.

part.hint: Consider that dissolved substances are important in this pressure.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Pressure generated by dissolved proteins falls into the other category of pressures.
Correct. Hydrostatic pressure is the same as blood pressure.
Incorrect. Pressure generated by dissolved proteins falls into the other category of pressures.
Incorrect. You chose the correct category of pressure, but from the wrong compartment.

part.hint: Consider that hydrostatic pressure is what most people commonly think of as “pressure.”

response.feedback: Incorrect. You chose the correct category of pressure, but from the wrong compartment.
Incorrect. Colloid osmotic pressure is not the same as blood pressure.
Correct. Colloid osmotic pressure is the pressure created by dissolved proteins separated by a semipermeable membrane.
Incorrect. Colloid osmotic pressure is not the pressure exerted on the wall.

part.hint: Consider that dissolved substances are important in this pressure.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Pressure generated by dissolved proteins falls into the other category of pressures
Incorrect. You chose the correct category of pressure, but from the wrong compartment.
Incorrect. Pressure generated by dissolved proteins falls into the other category of pressures
Correct. This is the pressure exerted on the wall of the vessel by the fluid outside the vessel.

part.hint: Consider that hydrostatic pressure is what most people commonly think of as “pressure.”
